properties.description: Can create and edit content
Read-only access
Can manage governance workflows
Oversees budget planning and expenditure approvals
properties.focus_scope: Annual and quarterly budget planning, expenditure approval, and financial oversight
properties.objectives: ["Review and approve quarterly budgets","Monitor expenditure against approved limits","Approve exceptional spending requests"]
properties.inputs_required: ["Quarterly financial reports","Budget proposals from departments","Expenditure variance analysis"]
properties.phase_scheduling: Quarterly cycle, first week of each quarter
properties.invite_policy: Standing invite for all committee members. Guests require Chair approval 48h in advance.

entities.name: suggestion_2026_01_15_bc
entities.label: Need new procurement process for capital expenditures

properties.description: Need new procurement process for capital expenditures over 50k. Current manual approval chain takes too long.

properties.title: Revised Procurement Policy 2026
properties.rationale: Current process averages 18 days for approval. New workflow reduces this to 5 days while maintaining oversight.
properties.description: Introduce a two-stage digital approval workflow for all capital expenditure requests above 50k, with a 5-day SLA for first-stage review.
Review Q1 expenditure against plan and approve Q2 budget allocations.
properties.title: Q1 2026 Budget Review

properties.description: Reviews safety incidents, risk assessments, and compliance requirements
properties.focus_scope: Safety incident review, risk mitigation, and regulatory compliance
properties.objectives: ["Review all safety incidents within 24 hours","Maintain risk register and mitigation plans","Ensure regulatory compliance across operations"]
properties.inputs_required: ["Incident reports from field teams","Risk assessment updates","Regulatory change notifications"]
properties.outputs_expected: ["Incident response directives","Updated risk register","Compliance status reports"]

properties.description: Update emergency evacuation procedures to include remote workers and new building annex. Current procedures are 3 years old.
Review Q1 safety incidents, near-misses, and corrective actions status.
properties.title: Quarterly Safety Assessment

properties.description: Biweekly sprint planning session to define sprint goal and select backlog items

entities.name: suggestion_2026_01_20_sp
entities.label: Add estimation session before sprint planning

properties.description: Run a 30-minute async estimation session the day before sprint planning so team members can pre-size stories. This would cut planning duration significantly.
Define sprint 14 goal, review velocity from sprint 13, and select backlog items for the sprint.
properties.title: Sprint 14 Planning

properties.description: Short daily synchronisation — what did I do yesterday, what am I doing today, any blockers

properties.title: Daily sync — blockers and progress
properties.description: Each team member: yesterday, today, blockers. Parking lot for follow-ups.
End-of-sprint demo of completed work to stakeholders; gather feedback before retrospective

entities.name: suggestion_2026_02_07_sr
entities.label: Invite external stakeholders to sprint reviews

properties.description: Expand sprint review attendance to include key external stakeholders (customers, legal, compliance). Currently only internal team attends.

properties.title: Sprint 13 Demo & Stakeholder Feedback
properties.description: Demo completed features from sprint 13. Collect acceptance decisions from Product Owner and feedback from attendees.
Team reflects on the sprint process — what went well, what to improve, action items

entities.name: suggestion_2026_02_01_retro
entities.label: Use async retro board before the meeting

properties.description: Fill in retro board (went well / improve / action items) asynchronously 24h before the meeting so time is spent on discussion rather than writing.

properties.title: Async Retrospective Board Process
properties.rationale: Eliminates 20-25 minutes of silent writing time per retro, increases meeting quality, and gives quieter team members time to contribute thoughtfully.
properties.description: Team uses a shared digital board (e.g. Miro) populated at least 24 hours before each retrospective. The live meeting focuses entirely on prioritising action items.
Review action items from sprint 12 retro, discuss sprint 13 highlights and pain points, define 1-2 improvement actions for sprint 14.
properties.title: Sprint 13 Retrospective

properties.description: Weekly grooming session to clarify, estimate, and prioritise upcoming backlog items so they are sprint-ready

entities.name: suggestion_2026_01_27_br
entities.label: Create a Definition of Ready checklist

properties.description: Define formal acceptance criteria for stories entering the sprint — acceptance criteria written, dependencies identified, estimated. Stops half-baked stories reaching planning.

properties.title: Definition of Ready Checklist
properties.description: Adopt a 4-point Definition of Ready: (1) acceptance criteria written, (2) external dependencies identified, (3) story estimated in points, (4) UI mockup attached if applicable. Stories not meeting all 4 criteria cannot enter sprint planning.
properties.rationale: Sprint 11 had 3 stories pulled mid-sprint due to unclear requirements. A DoR prevents unready stories from reaching planning.

properties.description: Clarify and estimate 8-10 candidate stories for sprint 14. Apply Definition of Ready criteria; park items that don't qualify.
properties.title: Refine sprint 14 backlog candidates

properties.description: Records meeting minutes and manages documentation
Manages governance processes, ToRs, and proposal approvals
Oversees IT strategy, architecture decisions, and technology investments
properties.focus_scope: IT strategy, architecture governance, technology investment decisions, and vendor management
properties.objectives: ["Approve major IT architecture decisions","Oversee technology investment portfolio","Ensure alignment of IT initiatives with organizational strategy"]
properties.outputs_expected: ["Approved architecture decisions","Technology investment approvals","IT strategy updates"]

properties.description: Reviews and approves significant changes to IT systems and infrastructure
properties.focus_scope: Change risk assessment, approval of significant IT changes, post-implementation review
properties.objectives: ["Review and approve change requests above risk threshold","Assess impact and risk of proposed IT changes","Conduct post-implementation reviews for major changes"]
properties.inputs_required: ["Change requests from project teams","Risk assessments","Impact analysis reports"]

properties.notes: Architecture review completed. Cloud platform selection deferred to Q1 board.
Reviewed Q4 IT spend. Cloud platform options presented for decision next session.
Approved 3 standard changes. 1 emergency change post-review completed.
Cancelled due to insufficient quorum — Technical Lead position vacant.
Q4 2025 budget review completed. Procurement policy discussion tabled for February.

properties.title: Select Cloud Platform for 2026
properties.description: Review and select primary cloud platform for 2026 IT infrastructure migration. Choose between Azure and AWS based on cost analysis, capability assessment, and strategic fit.
Migrate primary IT infrastructure to Microsoft Azure. Leverages existing M365 integration, enterprise agreement pricing, and Azure AD identity management.
Migrate primary IT infrastructure to Amazon Web Services. Offers broader service portfolio, stronger developer tooling, and competitive spot instance pricing.

properties.rationale: Azure integration with our existing M365 and AD infrastructure significantly reduces migration complexity and operational overhead.
AWS provides superior developer tooling and more flexible pricing for our workload mix. The broader service catalogue future-proofs our architecture.

properties.description: Groomed and estimated stories from refinement enter sprint planning
Daily standup tracks progress against sprint planning commitments
Sprint review verifies completed work against planning commitments
Resolved blockers and daily progress updates lead to deliverables shown in review
Retrospective begins only after sprint review is complete and feedback is gathered
Agreed retrospective actions are addressed in the next sprint planning session
Acceptance criteria agreed in refinement used to verify completion at sprint review
Financial technology investment decisions escalate to IT Governance Board
Approved changes and architectural impacts feed into IT Governance Board review
properties.output_types: approved change records, architectural impact reports
